subject: Re: [junit] RFE: Make excluded.properties extensible
msgSnippet: ... ... Yes, I have done method 1, and also figured out method 2.  However, what I am suggesting is an enhancement to make life a little easier whereby either:
messageBody:
Steven Tania wrote:

> Mike
>
> There are couple of methods mentioned in the JUnit
> FAQ:
>
> "If you are using additional jars from 3rd party
> vendors you can either:
> update this file (excluded.properties) in the
> junit.jar and add your package paths or,

> 'patch' the junit.util.excluded.properties file with
> the CLASSPATH,
...

Yes, I have done method 1, and also figured out method 2. However, what I am
suggesting is an enhancement to make life a little easier whereby either:

1. an "excluded.properties" file be looked for in user.home, and whatever is
found in it either added to, or replaces the exclusions specified in the default
"excluded.properties" in the jarfile, OR

2. it be possible to added exclusion specifications to junit.properties (as an
alternative to creating Yet Another File To Configure (and Document).


--
